meanings.definition: The state or condition of being complete.
meanings.sent1: The completeness of the puzzle brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent2: His happiness was a result of the completeness of his collection.
meanings.sent3: The completeness of the cake was so perfect, it seemed almost too good to eat.
meanings.sent4: The completeness of the team's victory left their opponents in awe.
meanings.sent5: The completeness of the rainbow after the storm was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being whole or perfect.
meanings.sent1: She admired the completeness of the painting hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The completeness of his argument left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent3: The completeness of the plan was so flawless, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: The completeness of her joy was like a warm blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The completeness of the melody filled the room with a sense of peace.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is full or finished.
meanings.sent1: The completeness of the glass surprised him as he expected it to be half empty.
meanings.sent2: The completeness of the project was evident in every detail.
meanings.sent3: The completeness of the book made him want to read it all over again.
meanings.sent4: The completeness of the silence in the room was almost deafening.
meanings.sent5: The completeness of the garden in bloom was a sight to behold.
